verses.kjv: Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
verses.web: Now in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
verses.ct: In the 3rd year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel, Hezekiah son of Ahaz, king of Judah, began to reign.

verses.kjv: Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.
verses.web: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Abi the daughter of Zechariah.
verses.ct: He was 25 years old when he became king, and he reigned 29 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that David his father did.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, according to all that David his father had done.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the eyes of the LORD, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.kjv: He removed the high places, and brake the images, and cut down the groves, and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.
verses.web: He removed the high places, and broke the pillars, and cut down the Asherah. He also broke in pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made, because in those days the children of Israel burned incense to it; and he called it Nehushtan.
verses.ct: He removed the high places, smashed the sacred pillars, and cut down the Asherah poles. He also broke into pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made, because up to that time the Israelites had been burning incense to it. He called it Nehushtan.

verses.kjv: He trusted in the LORD God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor any that were before him.
verses.web: He trusted in LORD, the God of Israel; so that after him was no one like him among all the kings of Judah, nor among them that were before him.
verses.ct: He trusted in the LORD, the God of Israel. There was no one like him among all the kings of Judah — neither those who came after him nor those who came before him.

verses.kjv: For he clave to the LORD, and departed not from following him, but kept his commandments, which the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: For he joined with LORD. He didn’t depart from following him, but kept his commandments, which LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He held fast to the LORD and never turned away from following him. He kept the commandments that the LORD had given to Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was with him; and he prospered whithersoever he went forth: and he rebelled against the king of Assyria, and served him not.
verses.web: LORD was with him. Wherever he went, he prospered. He rebelled against the king of Assyria, and didn’t serve him.
verses.ct: The LORD was with him, and he prospered in everything he undertook. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and refused to serve him.

verses.kjv: He smote the Philistines, even unto Gaza, and the borders thereof, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.
verses.web: He struck the Philistines to Gaza and its borders, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.
verses.ct: He defeated the Philistines all the way to Gaza and its borders, from the smallest watchtower to the largest fortified city.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.
verses.web: In the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.
verses.ct: In the 4th year of King Hezekiah, which was the 7th year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria marched against Samaria and laid siege to it.

verses.kjv: And at the end of three years they took it: even in the sixth year of Hezekiah, that is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.
verses.web: At the end of three years they took it. In the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.
verses.ct: After 3 years they captured it. In the 6th year of Hezekiah, which was the 9th year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria fell.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria did carry away Israel unto Assyria, and put them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes:
verses.web: The king of Assyria carried Israel away to Assyria, and put them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes,
verses.ct: The king of Assyria deported Israel to Assyria and settled them in Halah, along the Habor River in Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.kjv: Because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD their God, but transgressed his covenant, and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them.
verses.web: because they didn’t obey LORD their God’s voice, but transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of LORD commanded, and would not hear it or do it.
verses.ct: This happened because they did not obey the voice of the LORD their God but violated his covenant — everything that Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded. They refused to listen or obey.

verses.kjv: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all the fenced cities of Judah, and took them.
verses.web: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them.
verses.ct: In the 14th year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou puttest on me will I bear. And the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
verses.web: Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, “I have offended you. Return from me. That which you put on me, I will bear.” The king of Assyria appointed to Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
verses.ct: Hezekiah king of Judah sent a message to the king of Assyria at Lachish, saying, "I have done wrong. Withdraw from me, and I will pay whatever you demand." The king of Assyria required Hezekiah king of Judah to pay 300 talents of silver and 30 talents of gold.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king’s house.
verses.web: Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in LORD’s house, and in the treasures of the king’s house.
verses.ct: So Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD and in the treasuries of the royal palace.

verses.kjv: At that time did Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of the LORD, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.
verses.web: At that time, Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of LORD’s temple, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: At that time Hezekiah stripped the gold from the doors of the LORD's temple and from the doorposts that he himself had overlaid, and he gave it to the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.web: The king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great army to Jerusalem. They went up and came to Jerusalem. When they had come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.ct: Then the king of Assyria sent Tartan, Rabsaris, and Rabshakeh from Lachish to King Hezekiah with a massive army against Jerusalem. They marched up and arrived at Jerusalem, and when they got there, they took their position by the aqueduct of the upper pool, on the road to the washerman's field.

verses.kjv: And when they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.
verses.web: When they had called to the king, Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebnah the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder came out to them.
verses.ct: When they called for the king, Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, came out to them along with Shebna the secretary and Joah son of Asaph, the recorder.

verses.kjv: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?
verses.web: Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘The great king, the king of Assyria, says, “What confidence is this in which you trust?
verses.ct: Rabshakeh said to them, "Tell Hezekiah this is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: 'What are you basing your confidence on?'

verses.kjv: Thou sayest, (but they are but vain words,) I have counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
verses.web: You say (but they are but vain words), ‘There is counsel and strength for war.’ Now on whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?
verses.ct: You claim to have strategy and military strength, but these are nothing but empty words. Who are you relying on that you have rebelled against me?

verses.kjv: Now, behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt unto all that trust on him.
verses.web: Now, behold, you trust in the staff of this bruised reed, even in Egypt. If a man leans on it, it will go into his hand, and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust on him.
verses.ct: Look, you are trusting in Egypt — that splintered reed of a staff! If anyone leans on it, it pierces his hand and wounds him. That is what Pharaoh king of Egypt is to everyone who trusts in him.

verses.kjv: But if ye say unto me, We trust in the LORD our God: is not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?
verses.web: But if you tell me, ‘We trust in LORD our God;’ isn’t that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?’
verses.ct: But if you tell me, 'We trust in the LORD our God' — isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, telling Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship before this altar in Jerusalem'?

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord the king of Assyria, and I will deliver thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
verses.web: Now therefore, please give pledges to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.
verses.ct: Come now, make a wager with my master, the king of Assyria. I will give you 2,000 horses — if you can find enough riders to put on them!

verses.kjv: How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.web: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
verses.ct: How can you repel even one of the least of my master's officers? Yet you put your trust in Egypt for chariots and horsemen!

verses.kjv: Am I now come up without the LORD against this place to destroy it? The LORD said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.
verses.web: Have I now come up without LORD against this place to destroy it? LORD said to me, ‘Go up against this land, and destroy it.’ ” ’ ”
verses.ct: Furthermore, do you think I have come against this place to destroy it without the LORD's approval? The LORD himself told me, 'Go up against this land and destroy it.'"

verses.kjv: Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebna, and Joah, unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and talk not with us in the Jews’ language in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
verses.web: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, Shebnah, and Joah, said to Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in the Syrian language, for we understand it. Don’t speak with us in the Jews’ language, in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”
verses.ct: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, Shebna, and Joah said to Rabshakeh, "Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. Don't speak to us in the Jews' language within earshot of the people on the wall."

verses.kjv: But Rabshakeh said unto them, Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men which sit on the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?
verses.web: But Rabshakeh said to them, “Has my master sent me to your master and to you, to speak these words? Hasn’t he sent me to the men who sit on the wall, to eat their own dung, and to drink their own urine with you?”
verses.ct: But Rabshakeh replied, "Did my master send me to speak only to your master and to you? Didn't he send me to the men sitting on the wall — who will end up eating their own dung and drinking their own urine along with you?"

verses.kjv: Then Rabshakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and spake, saying, Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria:
verses.web: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and spoke, saying, “Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: Then Rabshakeh stood up and shouted loudly in the Jews' language, "Listen to the message of the great king, the king of Assyria!

verses.kjv: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand:
verses.web: The king says, ‘Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you out of his hand.
verses.ct: This is what the king says: 'Don't let Hezekiah deceive you, because he cannot rescue you from my power.

verses.kjv: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.web: Don’t let Hezekiah make you trust in LORD, saying, “LORD will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
verses.ct: Don't let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the LORD by saying, "The LORD will certainly deliver us, and this city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me, and then eat ye every man of his own vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his cistern:
verses.web: Don’t listen to Hezekiah.’ For the king of Assyria says, ‘Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and everyone of you eat from his own vine, and everyone from his own fig tree, and everyone drink water from his own cistern;
verses.ct: Don't listen to Hezekiah!' For this is what the king of Assyria says: 'Make peace with me and come out to me. Then each of you will eat from your own vine and your own fig tree and drink water from your own cistern,

verses.kjv: Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of oil olive and of honey, that ye may live, and not die: and hearken not unto Hezekiah, when he persuadeth you, saying, The LORD will deliver us.
verses.web: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and of honey, that you may live, and not die. Don’t listen to Hezekiah, when he persuades you, saying, “LORD will deliver us.”
verses.ct: until I come and take you to a land like your own — a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and honey. Choose life, not death! Don't listen to Hezekiah when he misleads you by saying, "The LORD will deliver us."

verses.kjv: Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.web: Has any of the gods of the nations ever delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
verses.ct: Has any god of any nation ever rescued his land from the power of the king of Assyria?

verses.kjv: Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? have they delivered Samaria out of mine hand?
verses.web: Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah? Have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
verses.ct: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? Did they rescue Samaria from my hand?

verses.kjv: Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of mine hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of mine hand?
verses.web: Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand, that LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?’ ”
verses.ct: Among all the gods of these lands, which one has saved his country from my power? So how can the LORD deliver Jerusalem from my hand?'"

verses.kjv: But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king’s commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
verses.web: But the people stayed quiet, and answered him not a word; for the king’s commandment was, “Don’t answer him.”
verses.ct: But the people remained silent and did not answer him a single word, because the king had commanded, "Do not answer him."

verses.kjv: Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
verses.web: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, came with Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him Rabshakeh’s words.
verses.ct: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, along with Shebna the secretary and Joah son of Asaph the recorder, went to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported to him everything Rabshakeh had said.
